Maybe name new variable simply status? Völkerrechtlich umstrittene Gebiete: Es gibt bislang keine explizite RDB-Policy dazu, wir müssten daher etwas definieren. Bspw. werden alle Abstimmungen, die die Republik Kosovo betreffen, unter dem country_name Serbia geführt… für die Abstimmungen Taiwan uneinheitliche country_name’s verwendet, für die Abstimmungen 2018-11-24 Taiwan, Province China, für die anderen einfach Taiwan… Pragmatisch wäre, einfach die Handhabung der offiziellen/diplomatischen Schweiz zu übernehmen. obviously much consistency referendum titles three languages captured. title: TODOs
text: Bei verschiedenen Abstimmungen meldet sudd.ch “id=…” ist gelöscht , weil keine Volksabstimmung stattgefunden hat. Betroffen sind die folgenden Abstimmungen: Ägypten 1976-06-10; bei uns: 5bbbe82f92a21351232e0381 New Zealand 1931-12-02; bei uns 3 Einträge, jeweils einer pro Option: 5bbbe29792a21351232de3c9, 5bbbe29792a21351232de3c7, 5bbbe29792a21351232de3c7 Puerto Rico 1952-11-04 (3. Abstimmungsvorlage “Abolition certain social rights”), bei uns: 5bbbe2ba92a21351232ded1f Falls diesen Fällen tatsächlich keine Abstimmungen stattfanden, sollten die Einträge aus der RDB entfernt werden! Bei der Abstimmung Norfolk Island 1980-07-10 meint sudd.ch, sie habe stattdessen 1979-07-10 stattgefunden. Falls sudd.ch Recht hat, sollte das korrigiert werden. Silagadze & Gherghina (2019) (S. 467) detected referendums missing database -> systematically check/add ! include Italy 1929 1934, Andorra 1933, Austria 1938, Romania 2009, Slovenia 2015, Bulgaria 2016, Netherlands 2016, UK 2016.

text: total 858 referendums don’t type set though ’s mandatory field (least C2D admin interface) -> missing types traced added ASAP! following referendums, votes_* electorate_* numbers double-checked possibly corrected since electorate_total < sum(votes_*), definition impossible: probably also double-check improbably high turnout numbers, e.g. > 0.9: Complete add Aargau cantonal referendums 1888–1971 issue #29 resolved. Also add referendums similar Excel sheets remaining 25 cantons got. See HLS R project partial data cleansing/tidying. Voting id == "5bbbfee992a21351232e4f37" (Romania 2008-02-01) limited region Szeklerland, therefore subnational_entity set Székely Land Sobald via Admin-Interface nach Draft-Status gefiltert werden kann, sollten die existierenden Drafts geprüft werden -> entweder vervollständigen und freischalten oder löschen! Clean id_official; likely erroneous entries ones don’t designate id_official another kind ID; entries double-check: Plus: Nobody knows id_official = "0" means, replaced NA (proper id_official can determined). municipality scheint inkonsistent zugewiesen; enthält Werte, die klar eine Gemeinde bezeichnen (bspw. "London"), aber auch solche wie "Republic Serbian Krajina 1991" oder Republic Serbian People (1963-1992)… bei letzteren sollte der passende country_code_historical für “Yugoslavia” gesetzt werden der country_code = "CS" für den Folgestaat “Serbia Montenegro” gesetzt werden (oder besser leer lassen? TBD!) is_past_jurisdiction = TRUE gesetzt werden den gegenwärtigen Wert municipality stattdessen subnational_entity_name eintragen Die Abstimmungen Netherlands 2005-04-08 und 2014-12-17 fanden genau genommen auf Sint Eustatius statt, siehe sudd.ch-Einträge (1, 2); Sint Eustatius ist zwar eine Besondere Gemeinde der Niederlande, besitzt aber einen eigenen ISO-Ländercode (BQ-SE) etc. Sollte daher als country_name nicht besser Sint Eustatius eingetragen werden? Andernfalls sollte subnational_entity auf "Sint Eustatius" gesetzt werden, da ja nicht die gesamte Niederlande abstimmen konnte! Die Abstimmungen France 2006-02-23 und 2006-09-06 beziehen sich auf Referenden Sark, country_name sollte daher auf "United Kingdom" oder (besser?) "Guernsey" gesetzt werden und subnational_entity = "Sark"! Regarding data subnational referendums US, currently know two --date compilations: Ballotpedia maintains List veto referendum ballot measures, seems rich information. National Conference State Legislatures (NCSL) maintains Statewide Ballot Measures Database “includes statewide ballot measures 50 states District Columbia, starting century ago”. ’s unclear () data database exactly includes, might also viable avenue automated additions database. NCSL also provides information institutional conditions regarding direct democracy US states, e.g. . Also rich information Wikipedia provides article Initiatives referendums United States

text: package borrows lot Tidyverse design philosophies. R code adheres principles specified Tidyverse Design Guide wherever possible formatted according Tidyverse Style Guide (TSG) following exceptions: Line width limited 160 characters, double limit proposed TSG (80 characters ridiculously little given today’s high-resolution wide screen monitors). Furthermore, preferred style breaking long lines differs. Instead wrapping directly expression’s opening bracket suggested TSG, prefer two fewer line breaks indent subsequent lines within expression opening bracket: results less vertical horizontal spread code better readability pipes. Usage magrittr’s compound assignment pipe-operator %<>% desirable2. Usage R’s right-hand assignment operator -> allowed3. R source code split several files suggested TSG instead (far possible) kept single file Rmd/rdb.Rmd well-structured thanks Markdown support. far possible, deviations TSG plus additional restrictions formally specified lintr configuration file .lintr, lintr can used right away check formatting issues:

what: Add UN world regions to referendum data — add_world_regions
title: Add UN world regions to referendum data — add_world_regions
text: Augments data information United Nations (UN) geoscheme three different grouping tiers based UN M49 area code hierarchy. total, eight different columns added: un_country_code: UN M49 country code un_region_tier_1_code: UN tier-1 region's M49 area code un_region_tier_1_name: UN tier-1 region's English name un_region_tier_2_code: UN tier-2 region's M49 area code un_region_tier_2_name: UN tier-2 region's English name un_region_tier_3_code: UN tier-3 region's M49 area code un_region_tier_3_name: UN tier-3 region's English name un_subregion: Combinatiorial English UN subregion name , except Northern Europe, corresponds lowest un_region_tier_*_name. Tier-1 regions highest, .e. aggregated UN regions, commonly referred continents. Tier-2 regions also known "subregions" tier-3 regions "sub-subregions". part UN tier-2 regions divided UN tier-3 regions, meaning countries part UN tier-3 region. country belong UN tier-3 region, corresponding un_region_tier_3_* values simply NA. un_subregion column specifically addresses issue providing uniform combination un_region_tier_2_name un_region_tier_3_name.

title: Infer higher-tier topics — infer_topics
text: Determines top-tier (tier = 1L) second-tier (tier = 2L) topics corresponding topics hierarchy, .e. either topics (grand)parent topics.

title: Infer higher-tier topics — infer_topics
text: topics Topics corresponding (grand)parent topics determined. factor character vector. tier Tier inferred topics. Either 1L 2L.

title: Infer higher-tier topics — infer_topics
code: rdb::infer_topics(topics = c("EU", "animal protection"),                   tier = 1L) #> [1] "foreign policy"               "environment and living space" rdb::infer_topics(topics = c("EU", "animal protection"),                   tier = 2L) #> [1] "European policy" "environment"      # topics of different tiers can mixed in `topics` rdb::infer_topics(topics = c("EU", "environment"),                   tier = 2L) #> [1] "European policy" "environment"      # but `topics` of a higher tier than `tier` will be ignored rdb::infer_topics(topics = "foreign policy",                   tier = 2L) #> character(0)

what: List referendum data from sudd.ch — list_sudd_rfrnds
title: List referendum data from sudd.ch — list_sudd_rfrnds
text: Lists referendum data sudd.ch various ways list.php endpoint allows. output function can directly fed sudd_rfrnds().

title: List referendum data from sudd.ch — list_sudd_rfrnds
code: list_sudd_rfrnds(   mode = c("by_date", "by_mod_date", "filter", "random"),   order = c("ascending", "descending"),   filter = list(territory_name_de = NULL, title_de = NULL, year_min = NULL, year_max =     NULL),   use_cache = TRUE,   max_cache_age = "1 week",   quiet = FALSE )

title: List referendum data from sudd.ch — list_sudd_rfrnds
text: mode listing mode. One "by_date": Lists referendums sudd.ch database date, together id_sudd, country_code, territory_name_de title_de. Specifying sorting order results via order parameter supported. "by_mod_date": Lists referendums sudd.ch database date_last_edited, together id_sudd, country_code, territory_name_de, date title_de. "filter": Allows provide additional arguments (via filter parameter) limit results accordingly. Specifying sorting order results via order parameter supported. "random": Lists id_sudd five randomly selected referendums, together country_code. order sorting order results. relevant mode either "by_date" "filter". filter list valid filtering arguments. relevant mode = "filter". supported filtering arguments include territory_name_de: string must (partially) matched referendums' territory_name_de. Matching case-insensitive fuzzy matching supported. title_de: string must (partially) matched referendums' title_de. Matching case-insensitive fuzzy matching supported. year_min: lower year limit referendums' date. positive integer. year_max: upper year limit referendums' date. positive integer. use_cache Return cached results possible. FALSE, results always newly fetched regardless max_cache_age. max_cache_age duration cached results refreshed (.e. newly fetched). valid lubridate duration. Use Inf disable cache expiry. relevant use_cache = TRUE. quiet Whether suppress printing status output internal processing.

what: Count number of referendums per period — n_rfrnds_per_period
title: Count number of referendums per period — n_rfrnds_per_period
text: Counts number RDB referendums per desired period, optionally additional columns specified via .

title: Count number of referendums per period — n_rfrnds_per_period
code: n_rfrnds_per_period(   data,   by = NULL,   period = c("week", "month", "quarter", "year", "decade", "century"),   fill_gaps = TRUE,   period_floor = NULL,   period_ceiling = NULL,   descending = FALSE )

title: Count number of referendums per period — n_rfrnds_per_period
text: data RDB referendum data returned rfrnds(). data frame minimum contains column specified period column date (compute period column), plus one(s) specified via (). Optional data column(s) group counting number referendums. Tidy selections supported. period Type period count referendums . One "week","month","quarter","year","decade" "century". fill_gaps Whether add zero-value rows result period gaps data. period_floor Lower period limit gaps filled. NULL, lower limit set minimum period present data. relevant fill_gaps = TRUE period set unique timespan type ("year", "decade" "century"). period_ceiling Upper period limit gaps filled. NULL, upper limit set maximum period present data. relevant fill_gaps = TRUE period set unique timespan type ("year", "decade" "century"). descending Whether sort resulting table period descending ascending order.

title: Count number of referendums per period — n_rfrnds_per_period
Count number of referendums per period — n_rfrnds_per_period
text: Note period types "year", "decade" "century" unique timespans, "week", "month" "quarter" recurring timespans (e.g. every year week 1).

Topic segmentation sunburst chart — plot_topic_segmentation
text: Creates Plotly sunburst chart visualizes hierarchical segmentation referendum topic occurences.

title: Topic segmentation sunburst chart — plot_topic_segmentation
text: data RDB referendum data returned rfrnds(). data frame minimum contains columns topics_tier_1, topics_tier_2 topics_tier_3. method Applied method count number topic occurences. One "per_rfrnd": referendums weight. referendum n different topics tier, every topic counted 1/n. "per_topic_lineage": topic lineages weight. referendum n different topics tier, every topic fully counted, meaning e.g. referendum three different tier-3 topics tripled impact result compared referendum single one. Noticeably faster "per_rfrnd". "naive": Naive procedure properly reflect topic proportions tier 2 3. Based (wrong) assumptions ) referendums number topic lineages assigned b) topics deduplicated per tier. far fastest method, though.

title: Topic segmentation sunburst chart — plot_topic_segmentation
text: topic lineage hierarchical compound topic_tier_1 optionally grandchild topic_tier_3 /child topic_tier_2. Note topics can assigned tier referendums (.e. one case, topic_tier_1 plus child topic_tier_2 assigned, another case topic_tier_1 without child topic). Furthermore, noted every topic_tier_2 potential child topic_tier_3s. See full topic hierarchy details.

title: Get referendum data — rfrnds
text: country_code country_code(s) included. character vector. subnational_entity_name subnational_entity_name(s) included. character vector. municipality municipality(s) included. character vector. level level(s) included. character vector. type type(s) included. character vector. date_min minimum date included. date something coercible . date_max maximum date included. date something coercible . is_draft TRUE means include referendum entries draft status, FALSE include normal entries. Set NULL order include draft normal entries. date_time_created_min minimum date_time_created included. datetime, something coercible (like "2006-01-02" "2006-01-02T15:04:05Z"; assumed UTC timezone given). date_time_created_max maximum date_time_created included. datetime, something coercible (like "2006-01-02" "2006-01-02T15:04:05Z"; assumed UTC timezone given). date_time_last_edited_min minimum date_time_last_edited included. datetime, something coercible (like "2006-01-02" "2006-01-02T15:04:05Z"; assumed UTC timezone given). date_time_last_edited_max maximum date_time_last_edited included. datetime, something coercible (like "2006-01-02" "2006-01-02T15:04:05Z"; assumed UTC timezone given). query_filter valid MongoDB JSON query filter document allows maximum control data included. takes precedence listed parameters, .e. query_filter provided, parameters country_code, subnational_entity_name, municipality, level, type, date_min, date_max, is_draft, date_time_created_min, date_time_created_max, date_time_last_edited_min date_time_last_edited_max ignored. incl_archive Whether include archive column containing data earlier, obsolete state Referendum Database (RDB). tidy Whether tidy referendum data, .e. apply various data cleansing tasks add additional variables. FALSE, raw MongoDB referendum data modified just enough able return tibble. Note untidy data conform codebook (.. different variable names). use_cache Return cached results possible. FALSE, results always newly fetched regardless max_cache_age. max_cache_age duration cached results refreshed (.e. newly fetched). valid lubridate duration. Use Inf disable cache expiry. relevant use_cache = TRUE. use_testing_server Whether use testing servers instead production servers RDB Services API calls etc. quiet Whether suppress printing status output internal processing.

title: Tabulate number of referendums per period — tbl_n_rfrnds_per_period
text: Creates ready--print gt table number referendums per period, optionally counted two additional columns.

title: Tabulate number of referendums per period — tbl_n_rfrnds_per_period
code: tbl_n_rfrnds_per_period(   data,   by = NULL,   period = c("week", "month", "quarter", "year", "decade", "century"),   fill_gaps = TRUE,   period_floor = NULL,   period_ceiling = NULL,   squeeze_zero_rows = TRUE,   descending = TRUE,   add_total_row = TRUE,   add_total_col = NULL )

title: Tabulate number of referendums per period — tbl_n_rfrnds_per_period
text: data RDB referendum data returned rfrnds(). data frame minimum contains column specified period column date (compute period column), plus one(s) specified via (). two additional data column(s) group counting number referendums. Tidy selections supported. period Type period count referendums . One "week","month","quarter","year","decade" "century". fill_gaps Whether add zero-value rows result period gaps data. period_floor Lower period limit gaps filled. NULL, lower limit set minimum period present data. relevant fill_gaps = TRUE period set unique timespan type ("year", "decade" "century"). period_ceiling Upper period limit gaps filled. NULL, upper limit set maximum period present data. relevant fill_gaps = TRUE period set unique timespan type ("year", "decade" "century"). squeeze_zero_rows Whether compress consecutive zero-sum rows single period span rows. descending Whether sort resulting table period descending ascending order. add_total_row Whether add summary row end table containing column totals. add_total_col Whether add summary column end table containing row totals. NULL, total column added non-empty.
